title: 103_hr568
content: The Act titled "Contraception and Infertility Research Centers Act of 1993" authorizes grants and contracts for research centers focusing on contraception and infertility under the Public Health Service Act. The Act authorizes grants and contracts for centers focusing on improving contraception and infertility treatment. The Director of the Institute will establish three contraception centers and two infertility centers. Each center will conduct research to improve methods of contraception and infertility treatment. The Act authorizes grants for centers to conduct clinical trials on new drugs and devices for contraception and infertility treatment. Centers will also develop training protocols and programs for healthcare professionals and disseminate information to the public. The Act authorizes grants for centers to conduct clinical trials on new drugs and devices for contraception and infertility treatment. Centers may use funds to provide stipends for health professionals and fees for clinical trial subjects. The Director will coordinate information among the centers, and each center must use the facilities of a single institution or consortium. Support for a center may be for up to 5 years, with possible extensions. The Act authorizes grants for centers to conduct clinical trials on new drugs and devices for contraception and infertility treatment. Centers may receive funding for up to 5 years, with possible extensions of additional periods not exceeding 5 years if recommended by a peer review group. $30,000,000 is authorized for fiscal year 1994, with additional funding as needed for fiscal years 1995 and 1996. A loan repayment program for research on contraception and infertility is added to the Public Health Service Act. The Secretary, in consultation with the Director of the National Institute of Child Health and Human Development, shall establish a program for qualified health professionals to conduct research on contraception or infertility in exchange for up to $20,000 repayment of educational loans per year. This program is similar to the National Health Service Corps Loan Repayment Program. Amounts appropriated for this program will be used accordingly. Title III states that amounts appropriated for this program will remain available until the end of the second fiscal year after the initial appropriation.
